channel.title: Developing a Client Based Mini-OS
channel.description:
If that title makes any sense. I'm looking into programming a Client Based mini operating system. Basically what I mean by that is that I am going to develop my own GUI for a program that would ACT like an operating system. In no way really would it be an operating system, Just more of an Ease of Access program. And I'm not sure if it is in the right section. Should this be in a help section or development team section? Please move if so.
I am in need of a few extra people to help. I need a graphic designer. Somebody who can create background images and graphics for wallpapers, Pictures, Logo's, etc...
If anybody could help me out? The more experienced you are the better. And if you could post a few pictures of other graphics you have previously made, that would help me pick who I would like to help me.
Now I know that I may seem pretty stupid posting this, I do not have any payment to trade for work. I can only offer credits in the project. Again, Anybody willing to help would be greatly appreciated.
- Austin(Tino)
*EDIT* I just read the rules. I do not have my current work up on this post because I kind of want the project GUI and looks to be a surprise.
EDIT* To keep this Topic maintained. I will post 3 Program icons that I developed earlier this week. They were all custom made by me, I kept the names original. Text Editor(TE), Internet Viewer(IV). Just because if they were other names people might get confused with new program names since they are unheard of. Of course There will be an option to change the names, add different programs. Change the icons. ETC. This project will not be done for months. I assure you this. Maybe years. And it won't even be a real operating system. Just a client program.
[IMG]http://i725.photobucket.com/albums/ww251/austinsobes/TEICO.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i725.photobucket.com/albums/ww251/austinsobes/IVICO.jpg[/img]

item.title: Developing a Client Based Mini-OS
item.dc:creator: @austinsobes austinsobes
item.description:
@austinsobes wrote:

Davidi2:

This is stupid argument. I’m reporting this thread to a moderator, and I hope they read my earlier post.

I posted development David. You aren’t even in the argument. So why do you care? And as for n10si t.
I am looking for a graphic designer because I can’t do the work that I required. I am not skilled enough. So stop acting like you know the answer, because you obviously don’t. Right from those 2 words, your as bad as Vain. You don’t like to read the context clues.

[quote=“Si Force, post:13, topic:356547”]From what I’ve seen on this thread is that you’ve stated that you are programming a Client based mini-os, but what you are asking for is people to design the graphics, which to my understanding has nothing to do with the “General Programming” section at all.

Unless you can provide some evidence that this has something to do with programming and not just hiring graphics people, I’ll have to move this over to mitb.

Edit: another moderator can move the thread if they want, unless they want to wait for his reply to my comment.[/quote]
may I post code snippits then? I don’t want the coding to be given away or anything but if It will keep my topic alive I will. Would that be acceptable? Some code snippets of variables and settings for my login buttons && create user buttons?

EDIT* I apology, I misread your question. This topic is just for me to try to find somebody to make graphic images for me. Not about what I have done in the programming area already. Would a moderator move this to the graphics request section or w/e it is called? I don’t visit mopar a lot. Maybe twice a day.

Read full topic

But it does. Yet again you fail to read and understand the fucking concept you ignoramus.

  2. Stop trying to get this topic locked because it has everything to do with programming, just because you lost an arguement doesn’t mean you have to try to stop the entire conversation itself.

It has to do with programming because I need splash screens for the Client. I need Icons. I need changeable wallpapers. They can’t change by the user unless I program the settings to do so. Therefore I need to PROGRAM the pictures and settings and buttons. Nice try though.[/quote]
